programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick searches for a pair of 1920s petrol pumps, but a 1930s horse-gambling wheel catches his eye.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team returns a 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox to its former glory, while Rick makes a deal to buy a 1940s vending machine.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's rescue team is presented with a mammoth task when a trailer of cat food bursts into flames. Meanwhile, Bruce gets into a fight that lands him in hospital. Documentary series following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team as it patrols Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: Daniel meets a human crash test dummy, witnesses an escapologist in action, and discovers from a Samurai warrior if it is possible to slice a bullet in half with a sword.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The mother of triplets is found dead in her Washington home, leaving detectives to piece together her final moments in the hope of revealing her killer's identity.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of Â£1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: With panellists Bill Bailey, Alan Davies, Andy Hamilton and Helen Atkinson-Wood. Stephen Fry poses questions on chimpanzees, chromosomes and cuttlefish, awarding points to the answers he finds most intriguing.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer David Baddiel, former MP and Strictly Come Dancing 2016 star Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll and Celebrity MasterChef 2015 winner Kimberly Wyatt join host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Porridge star Mark Bonnar, actress Sheila Hancock, actor Stephen Mangan and radio and TV presenter Anita Rani join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Hannah Gadsby, Noel Fielding and Joe Lycett join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of pictures, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Melissa plays mind games with the group after being locked up for her own safety.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Todd and Tandy look into Melissa's past as they hunt for clues about her illness.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack are called to a petrol station where three people have been shot dead, and conclude it is the work of a concealed shooter working from long range - a sniper is at large in London. They combine ballistics and wound pathology with the killer-profiling skills of senior investigator DCI Jane De Freitas, as they work to find this seemingly random murderer before panic hits the city. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Zoe Telford and Steve Wall.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.sub-title: This is Not a Love Song
programme.desc: Hugh and Penny are forced together during an overnight trip to a coal mine, and Meryl turns failure into success when she unveils a new statue to commemorate the town.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh decides to tell Ajax the truth about their relationship, against his family's advice, but it does not go as planned.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: We Love Songs From Xmas Ads
programme.desc: Holidays are coming! These are some of our favourite songs from the Xmas adverts over the years.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Takin' It Old Skool
programme.desc: We're takin' you back to the old skool with some of the best tracks from the last few decades.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The mining of precious opals beneath a hot desert, the making of nougat and how stunt planes are built.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a cheap BMW M5 in a terrible condition, and Edd China has his work cut out trying to rejuvenate the dilapidated vehicle so it can turn a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is delighted to find a 1963 427 Cobra in a barn, and he and Roger manage to get it running and take it for a ride.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini goes to a sale in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, in a bid to purchase a range of Ford cars that were made between 1935 and 1940

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A fire causes red-hot metal shrapnel to rain over Dallas, a motorcycle daredevil survives a 200mph crash and a car is thrown half a mile by a huge explosion.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A helicopter co-pilot fights for his life after a crash, a man loses control of his powerboat at 125mph and a tanker blaze soon becomes a fireball.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby hopes to expand the business but is wary of making major purchases, while Joy has to deal with a broken truck, a permit crisis and 45-ton grinder.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip and the A-team design and overhaul Efrain Nieto's Olds 442 - will he be pleased with their handiwork?.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's quest to identify members of terrorist group Omega 7, whose crimes include bombings and assassinations including that of Cuban refugee leader Eulalio Jose Negrin.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the work of toxicologists, who use blood and tissue samples to solve gruesome murder cases.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Michelle Thornton, who disappeared on December 30, 2010. Footage from surveillance cameras in her building, plus fingerprints and DNA evidence led police to known felon Gary Wade.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Atlanta Prison riots of November 1987, which broke out when the US struck a deal with Cuba to repatriate up to 2,500 refugees held at the facility. The uprising lasted 11 days, involved more than 100 hostages, and saw a substantial portion of the prison destroyed by fire.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team rescues 30 dogs living in crowded and dirty conditions at a scrapyard in the desert.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a dog with a growth on its leg. However, after a thorough examination he finds a second lump in its mammary glands that could prove to be more sinister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dina is ready to try on her dress, while Carla disagrees with her mother over how revealing her gown should be.
